content: May I ask for a review of #10139? It is the last prerequisite for a satisfactory uniqueness result for Haar measures in #9909. I realize that it's probably a little bit hard to review as it's not completely standard material -- but the upshot is that once #9909 is in we will have stronger uniqueness results for the Haar measure than in any textbook or article I know of, which is quite nice!
@Sébastien Gouëzel The build failed due to relying on a transitive import, you probably need to merge master and import Mathlib.Topology.UrysohnsLemma directly

I added comments, but realized that it was too late…

  • There is apparently no notion of the support of a measure in mathlib…
  • Modulo countability hypotheses, measures form a sheaf, even for a Grothendieck topology where the “open” sets are locally closed subsets. I wonder about the nature of the sheaf-theoretic measures in general — objects that can be defined locally as measures which coincide on intersections.
  • The G-delta property holds not only for measures μ\muμ which are left invariant, but more generally for measures whose translates are given by multiplication by a function with full support (relative to μ\muμ).
#10139 has been merged in master, so now #9909 (strong uniqueness statements for Haar measures) is ready for review.

I wrote a few remarks on github. Here is another one I couldn't :
